Troy G. Ward (born 4 June 1962) is an American ice hockey coach and current assistant coach at Minnesota State University  Mankato. Ward spent three years (1997–2000) as assistant coach with the Pittsburgh Penguins of the National Hockey League.[http://hockeyandsons.com/troy.php Troy Wards Hockey & Sons Skills Boot Camp]
His playing career was from 1980 to 1984.
On June 30, 2011, following one year as an assistant coach, Ward was named as the new head coach of the Abbotsford Heat.[http://theahl.com/troy-ward-named-head-coach-in-abbotsford-p171473 TheAHL.com | The American Hockey League | Home Page]
He was named the head coach of the Vancouver Giants in the Western Hockey League (WHL) for the 2014–15 season but was released of his duties November 25, 2014, after 25 games.
On June 10, 2015, the Madison Capitols announced that Ward had accepted the dual role of head coach and general manager for the team's upcoming 2015–16 season. He resigned from both positions after one season.
